title: Work Great after 3-4 Years
text: I have spent lots of money on smart devices like many have. And we have children. I must say that after trying numerous smart devices, the most important aspect is that your products function for years to come without failure and with very minimal maintenance and upgrades. Avi-on smart plugs have been functioning well in our home. We experienced glitches and inconveniences with their software upgrades. Once the software was settled and glitches fixed, the lights are working as expected. We want to keep our kids safe and sound at home. The smart plugs products have helped us achieve that for 3 years now. We bought ours in the stores. Here is another thing: we do not want to spend $40 on smart devices. This is way too expensive for ordinary American families. It adds up fast with every single device and software costs. It is too too much. Who can afford $400 iPhones year after year?!? Oh maybe software makers can!?! They make good money. But we don’t!! We buy what we need, not what we like!  So I got my Avion plug for $25 at a local store, which was affordable price. Others weren’t as lucky as I. After 3-4 years, my Avi-on products are still all working in my home with zero maintenance and no fail. So I am a very happy Mom. Now I just hope this product lasts forever as it is. Fingers crossed.

title: You designed the firmware & software for GE plug in switch to fail
text:
You designed the firmware & software for GE plug in switch to fail without any way to make it communicate again short of sending it to you at my cost and possibly not getting it back, should you decide it is broken?

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!!! Why design something to be robust when you could instead design something that not only EASILY FAILS, but then becomes PERMANENTLY unable to communicate with any device.  And, yes, I meticulously went through all your myriad pages upon linked pages without skipping or mis-ordering any of the instructions.  I have one switch that still works and one that can no longer be seen by any device, and therefore cannot be added again, no matter what I have done.  Yes, I’ve tried holding the button, much longer than required for reset. I have even gone so far as to completely delete and then reinstall the app, and one switch still works while the other is invisible and cannot be added.  I have even deleted and re-added the working switch on my account successfully.  No, they weren’t in separate accounts.  Yes, I have repeated your steps again, with perfect attention to detail.  No, it was not damaged.  It was treated exactly as the working switch was treated, and it used to work.  Product is poor.  There should be a class action suit to have the failed ones replaced.

title: Support Was Tremendous
text:
I have had a switch and used the app for a couple of years. I bought two new outdoor switches and although the switches worked I could not get the app to function properly. I contacted the Avi-On support team and they immediately responded within an hour or two. My switches had old firmware that needed updating but the app would not display the update symbol needed to initiate the update as well as some other functions such as changing the name of Devices or deleting schedules. The support team worked with me to try to resolve this problem. When no headway was being made they sent me two new switches that they had updated the firmware and I sent back my two with their prepaid shipping. After many emails back and forth they regenerated my account and I deleted the app and re-downloaded the app. Everything thing then worked. I can’t say enough about the support team for tirelessly pursuing the resolution to my problem. They went well beyond my expectations with email responses and phone calls that in some cases were after their normal business hours. My system now works perfectly. 

Gary S

title: Deceptive instructions - don’t waste your time
text:
I bought an Avi-on switch at Target without researching it first, which I rarely ever do. I set it up to turn a lamp on and off in the living room twice a day so my dogs won’t have to sit in the dark before I get home now that it gets dark so early. While setting it up there was not a single mention that it requires a remote access bridge to connect to it when I’m out of range. Because of that I’m not able to make any adjustments to the timer if I find I’m going to be out later than the lamp is set to turn off. The fact that that information is not anywhere in the instructions is extremely deceptive. 

Furthermore, after some googling I found I could connect to it via the Alexa app. NOPE. Alexa can’t find the device even if I’m sitting right next to it. I’m returning this piece of crap (the Avi-on device, not my Echo) and getting something else. 

Note: Avi-on Developers/Customer Service, please do not reply to this with one of your canned “we’d like to help you” responses. Unless you’re going to offer to send me a remote access bridge free of charge or refund my money, save it.

title: Customer service and software needs work.
text: I purchased 6 indoor and 2 outdoor switches two years ago to control xmas lights around the house. Everything worked flawlessly. This year we set up the lights and the app wouldn't recognize any of the switches. For the first few days our work around was to log out and back in every time we wanted to turn the lights on or off. The app wouldn't log back in and was giving an error message that it can't connect to my internet. Internet was working fine for everything else on my phone. Customer service was not helpful. I was finally able to solve the issue after reading through a bunch of reviews and finding the solution posted by another user. It required a very long software update process that needed to be done one switch at a time. Once software was updated they worked great again.

text: I’m not sure how old these reviews are or what anyone’s background is in lighting controls, but, I use 3 of the GE switches to control my landscape lighting all around my property. One of the switches controls 18 in-ground 6x9 paving stone lights, one controls pumps for fountains and one switch controls the rest of the outdoor home lighting that makes the house look like a million bucks. I select the zone I want turn it on and it works... EVERY SINGLE TIME! These complaints on here are mind boggling to me. title: Stay away
text:
Very unreliable.

After getting my password reset, it showed this impressive interface with nice and logical gestures. After I dismissed it, the app hung trying to connect to what I had registered before. title: Fabulously helpful, simple, and new!
text:
Avion devices have always been surprisingly intuitive in my experiences with them, which was my main concern when looking for smart home devices. I was worried about connectivity and remote control, etc etc. turns out, they JUST WORK. Unless you’re stupid and don’t realize that Bluetooth and home WiFi don’t have a 10 mile range, it’s obvious that a RAB (remote access bridge) is necessary. 
There’s a few different controls and devices, from the RAB which lets you control over the internet from anywhere, And the outlet switch that lets you use Bluetooth to dim/control ANY LIGHT you’ve already got installed: fluorescent, LED, especially incandescent, and Phillips Hue...provided its already dimmable obvi.
And the Bluetooth switch I mentioned is super cool, from your phone you can control literally any lamp in your house and program complex routines or simple ones  to turn on whenever you need. 
And there’s more! It’s been a life saver with energy bills $$$ And for our older dog who needs to see and for waking up and going to sleep along with just having total control from your phone. Pretty dope!

Remember... Bluetooth and WiFi only have a ‘small’ range; the Internet is infinite range. Golden rule.

title: Limited Features and Not Secure
text:
The GE Avi-on product line is a sort of poor man's home automation system. It relies on Bluetooth, which means that your iPhone or iPad must be near the devices to control them. (Remote control requires a proprietary gateway.) 

The limitations of this technology notwithstanding, the Avi-on app is a disaster. Half the time, tapping on the three dots to open a context menu for a device turns the device on or off, and half the time, it opens the desired menu.

Design errors in the app mean that not all context options are accessible when they should be. Getting device information, for example, is accessible from a secondary context menu, but the three-dot icon to open that menu is hidden by a + icon half the time. (When you've opened the first context menu and are thus working with a particular device, it makes no sense to be able to add other devices.)

Security for (required, server-side) Avi-on accounts is an afterthought. The only way to change your password is by pretending you've forgotten it, according to the company's support page. With no security questions or other verification measure, anyone with access to the password reset link -- sent in cleartext, to your last e-mail address -- can take over your Avi-on account. Since there's no remote control, at least the potential for mischief is limited.

title: Could be so awesome

So if you want to change the schedule you can’t because it’s no where to be found. I setup 4 schedules, 2 for each of my 2 devices. Currently only one schedule is left the other 3 disappeared (I did not touch them). They both still follow the schedules even though the schedules aren’t there/listed. title: Takes too long to connect
text: I bought this connectors to turn on the main light in my bedroom. This became the main power switch for the room after a previous device that had a wall mounted remote broke. The problem with this app is that it doesn’t maintain a constant Bluetooth connection so every time you want to open the app to turn on the light, the app has to search for the connector which takes several seconds and then you can turn the light on. This may not sound like much of a problem, but the app will drop the connection even if you leave it open in the background. The second your phones screen goes off, it disconnects. It would be nice if we had the option to keep the device and the app constantly connected when close. I’ve been using other sources of light for the room and haven’t even bothered trying to use this app.

title: No longer works
text:
Was useful, now completely useless. App does not connect to any of the 5 switches throughout the house. It does give a lengthy but confusing  error message about numbers of devices versus numbers of switches which is particularly frustrating as there has been neither a change to the number of devices nor to the number of switches.

Update: After logging out and logging back into my account, the app finally connected to one of the switches. An exclamation mark appeared above the switch name and when tapped, prompted for an update. The update process is...not simple. It involves toggling airplane mode several times per switch and some other nonsense. However, worth it for better functionality. Unfortunately, that was not the case. The scheduling feature (most of the appeal of this system for most users, I hazard) is completely unintuitive and possibly just broken. 

Still would give zero stars if possible.

Update 2: Subsequent updates have restored functionality to the switches, so I am adding a star for the effort. However, sometimes lights do not turn on when scheduled. Sometimes they do not turn off. Scheduling is still not intuitive or 95% reliable.

title: App is garbage
text:
Bought a GE Outdoor Smart Switch and works just fine, but I had to spend hours getting this crappy app to connect to my device. Had to restart my phone, unplug the switch, clear my cache, then it finally decided to connect to my app. ON/OFF switch in app worked, but when I tried using other buttons in the app, none of them worked. So, I exited the app and when I reopened it, my device was no longer connected. When I tried reconnecting, the device acted like it was already “claimed,” so I had to hard reset the switch and then go through all the hoops I already had to reconnect, then the same thing happened. 

The GE product is great, but GE really needs to partner with a better working software platform. Avi-On needs to do some serious fixing, or else everyone else will be returning their useless devices like me.

title: Helpful customer service
text: Been using a wall outlet control for almost a year now.  Decent product & has been working as advertised, until this weekend.  Suddenly the app completely forgot the device and I couldn't figure it out.  Contacted customer service via the online form & received a response within an hour.  We exchanged half a dozen messages over the next couple of hours, and they were ultimately able to get things reset and functioning again.  I must say, I was pleasantly surprised at the responsiveness and resolution.  I figured I just had a bluetooth paperweight...  Thanks guys!

title: Generally works but can be fussy if you need to change anything.
text: I was introduced to this brand at my local hardware store. It seemed like a reasonable solution so I bought it to control my front porch light. I soon became aware that you need to be standing within blue-tooth range to be able to make any adjustments to the scheduled program. (Usually just twice a year for winter and summer schedules - the “sundown to sunup” program isn’t very reliable). The problem surfaces when attempting to sign-in to the app. It NEVER remembers me, and more often than not won’t accept my password. Even after completing the reset obstacle course. Once inside, the user interface is workable but not necessarily the most intuitive.

title: Exceptional Customer Service
text: I’ve been using the Avi-on App for about a year, without any problems. I had to change my email address and ran into a glitch. After trying to figure it out on my own for the past day, I finally sent an email to get tech support, expecting a response in a day or so. I received a generic email with hints and a few minutes later I received an email from David, letting me know he had manually corrected my problem. This was at 8:00 PM, on a Sunday night!!!!  I’m still smiling and my problem is solved. Thank you Avi-on, especially David!

title: Connecting...NOT
text:
Here is what I was hoping for - plug and play (after downloading the app) - not even close...it simply will not connect - regardless of location, plug, reset...I even put it back it the box and then reopened to see if that helped...this should not be that difficult - and if it is then I don’t have the time or inclination to spend on on “time saving” power cord...

Update - I received an email from the Team on Sunday (kudos for someone working that day) the instructions were to return and they would update the unit and ship it back to me...in what world do you buy a product, then ship it back to the manufacturer, and then have them return it to you...not the world I live in...returned it to point of purchase and bought another type of unit - worked out of the box...as expected.

title: Love how this device/Rab/Alexia works
text:
The setup is fairly simple and for the most part it works very consistently. I love being able to turn my lights, fan, radio clock off by voice. The only time I have issue is usually with an update and it’s usually fixable. Tech-support is awesome. For hands-free system it’s hard to beat. 
I was having problems finding a Radio clock to wake me up with more than two schedules -in fact almost impossible. Yet this gave me the opportunity of making as many schedules as I wish to for a clock -awesome. You folks rock!

title: Hard to connect and needlessly limiting?
text: I am very glad that I tested out this app before deciding on purchasing a GE Plug-In Smart Switch. I plugged in the device while still in the store, and it took me about 10 tries just to connect it. Turns out I needed to reboot my phone first. A more informative error message would have been helpful. After that initial frustration, I was enormously dismayed to see that the scheduling is only programmable in 15 minute intervals? I was willing to spend the extra money on a smart switch precisely because I needed more control over it. I have water pump running a drip system for my potted plants that I’d like to turn on for 5 minute intervals throughout the day, but 15 minutes at a time drenches them. All said, I did not buy the smart switch because of this app.

title: Works After Firmware Update
text: Out of the box I could not connect to the GE In Wall Smart Switch over Bluetooth to my phone.  The guys at tech support worked with me to get the firmware updated and now the switch works as advertised.   The firmware difficulties took three star off my review but the help from tech support restored two of them.  After a few weeks the switch works flawlessly.  I’ve programmed the switch to turn-on and off at set times and I no longer have to think about it.  I’ve rated the switch now 5 stars.

title: Can’t manually turn on.
text:
The updates don’t seem to be very good. More to update the aesthetics of the app which doesn’t help with actually using the app. I tap the button for manually turning on and off the GE plug in switch and it does nothing. I’m able to delete schedules now (I wasn’t able to do that before), but not being able to use it without having to actually get up and push the button on the switch defeats the purpose of the app. 

Will change my review to four or five stars if this problem can be fixed, and the app becomes a little more user friendly.

title: Works perfectly
text: Read the instructions and follow them. YOU MUST connect the neutral wire, which you don't normally do when wiring a switch, if you don't do this the switch won't work. It is in the instructions as a diagram. I downloaded the app and the app was frozen so I restarted my phone and haven't had one problem. The sunset/sunrise feature works great and I like that I can turn the light on and off from my phone when I am not home. Worth the money just take your time to read the instructions and follow them!

title: Love the devices and app
text: I can wholeheartedly recommend these GE devices and the Avi-On app which makes it possible to easily customize the function of the devices. Additionally on those occasions were I needed help the customer support guided me through the resolution of my issue quickly and professionally. Customer support was excellent and will work with you until you are fully satisfied.  I can recommend the various FAQ pages that contain a wealth of information to help you get the most out of each device.

title: Never got an email for set up
text:
Swindled! Really wish I had read the reviews for this app before spending so much money on this GE smart dimmer. Shame on me for not doing my due diligence.

Registered online but never got a confirmation email. Tried to register on another device and I am told that my email is already in use. So, I have a dimmer that is as useless. 

I assumed the GE brand on the packaging meant this was a quality purchase. $40 mistake.

title: Don’t Waste Your Money
text: The device is great but the app is horrible. The app doesn’t perform well if you use it on multiple devices so I guess the app developer expects only one person in the house to control everything. The app loses connection easily and I often have to delete it and reinstall in order to access the app and my devices. I know it’s not my internet connection because the other device I purchased for comparison hasn’t had any issues. I bought this device from target in order to have a timer for my lights and when the system works it’s great but it has too many issues to be considered good. Save some money and time and find a different system with a better app.

title: Junk! Junk! Junk!
text:
UPDATE: Had a power failure last week and the worthless piece of crap is out of whack and I can’t figure out how to reset the time. This should be the easiest thing in the world, but this stupid app has no control to do it. WORTHLESS!

Yeah works OK once it’s set up and you can just walk away and let it run, but if you need to reset for daylight savings time or change the schedule because the sun is setting earlier, FORGET IT!!!!! Directions are either nonexistent or WRONG. Want to delete a schedule? Just swipe to the l—oh that doesn’t work. Just hit the edit button and choose del—oh there is no delete. Look up instructions on the internet—oh, good luck with that. Software is CRAP, by which I mean NOT user friendly.

title: Confusing
text: Using the app, I can create schedules, but once I save them, they cannot be edited or deleted. My only option is to turn the schedule off and create a new one. The app has promise, but seems to be unnecessarily aggravating. It’s like writing a Word document, but once the first draft has been saved, it can’t be edited or deleted, so you end up with dozens of drafts you can’t get rid off. Miserable. Why?

title: Useless App
text:
I bought a GE switch that advertised this technology because I needed to place a switch in an unreachable location, so the ability to control it from a distance was appealing. The switch itself is fine. The app is useless. I can’t even register because no matter how many times I enter my email address, it never sends me an email to complete registration. 

And reading other reviews, I guess I have to buy additional bridge software in order to actually use the product as planned. I already spent $42 on the switch - no way I’m spending another dime on it. 

These requirements should be explicit on the packaging. This is misleading on the part of both GE and Avi-On.

title: Terrible App
text: The hardware works great. I can set the timer and the lights go on and off as scheduled. I didn’t want wi-fi timers so the Bluetooth was great. The App is a disaster! Every few weeks all my schedules get dumped out of the app and it every device indicates “no schedule”. The switches still work to the schedule I had put in previously, but If I want to change one device or one schedule then I have to set up new schedules for every device. I also set my Mom up with 2 of the outdoor switches at Christmas for her exterior lights. Both were set up at the same time with the same schedule, however one came on an hour later than the other for the first 2 weeks. Bizarre!

title: Customer service
text: I installed 2 switches but had to un-install one of them. I then couldn't get that one to re-connect to the app. Customer service went over and above what I expected, to walk me through all the possible scenarios and keep in contact ( by email) until the switch worked again.  (The re-set was power off at breaker for 2 minutes).  Very satisfied

title: Horrible functionality
text:
This app takes forever to start up, does not integrate with anything worthwhile outside avi-on in a smart home capacity, and had a terrible workflow with unprofessional instructions during a firmware flash for my device. 

Now to use the scenes feature, a basic function of a software like this, I have to pay $16!? I already bought devices from GE. Had I known I would be signing up for a terrible app interface that doesn’t integrate with anything, and that the app would try to squeeze money from me to use basic features, I would absolutely have purchased another device. RUN don’t walk from all devices controlled by avi-on. Atrocious.

title: Leaving Avi-on
text: I’ve always been afraid to update when things seem to be working fine. I’ve noticed this app usually puts out an update, breaks what was working, and then puts out another update to fix what they broke. These last 2 updates were terrible. First update took away the simplicity of being able to turn off a device. Instead you had to set up some type of scene. Ug. A few days later another update came out and now I can’t even log in. Token error, login error, WiFi error. Once I was able to log in and all of my devices were gone. I’m done.

title: Incomplete app
text:
Advertised sunrise and sunset schedule functions do not work at all. 

Regular scheduling does work but the functionality is very annoying. You have to create individual schedules by selecting a time range (only one per schedule) and the days you want it active. Once this is done you cannot get back in to change anything. You have to create a new schedule and uncheck the old one (you can't delete).  This would kind-of be ok, although annoying, except there is a limit on how many schedules you can have.  Very frustrating. 

Also the light is colder running from this switch compared to the dimmer I had it on.

title: Great products!
text: I have had this app and these Bluetooth products for over 3 years now, still have had no trouble! Great to schedule lights for the workweek and weekend! I never come home to a dark house and feel safer. Great for busy parents, lights go off as we leave for school/work without having to think about it. Also great as an bedtime reminder, bedtime when the lights go out!

title: It takes a lot to impress me, but...
text: Five stars to David and his team. Although I had a few challenges with my scheduling on about 50 devices, the support team was with me the entire time...morning, evening, and nights.  Like most tech products once one understands what is going on, the process is rather simple. Thumbs up to  a remarkable product and client centric organization! Harry P.

title: Way to make something simple complicated
text: We used to spend 3-4 seconds a day turning on and off our two lights. Now we spend 10 minutes every other day trying to figure out why this stupid app and program won’t work. We get home to no lights, set it up, works one day then back to one of the two lights is wrong. No instructions on how to delete any of the programs are available. No help info anywhere on the app. Worked fine to begin with, then we did the required updates and it hasn’t worked right since. Don’t waste your time and money on anything related to this company.

title: DO NOT BUY!!
text:
I WISH I NEVER INVESTED SO MUCH MONEY IN THESE STUPID, EXPENSIVE SWITCHES! The technology in these products is SO ridiculously finicky. The app is broken, also. BE WARNED! Believe the app’s 1-star rating! It’s accurate.

A few updates ago, every device I have on here doubled. I now have duplicates of each Avi-on I own on my dashboard. However, when I try to delete the duplicates, the app says it cannot find them. Then it says, “Report as broken...Would you like to delete anyway?” I say, “Yes.” It says, “Deleting,” but never actually deletes them.

To make matters worse, the products no longer abide by my preset schedules...I need to manually turn them on and off now.

I’m sure some developer will respond to this by saying I need to uninstall and reinstall the app...yada, yada, yada. I DON’T WANT TO UNINSTALL AND REINSTALL!!! I DON’T WANT TO REPROGRAM ALL THE AVI-ON DEVICES I OWN AGAIN!! They are NOT easy to add and/or program!

I wish I could give 0 stars for all the frustration and time this product has caused me!

title: Possibly the worst ever!
text: I never write reviews. But this app is so terrible that I had to say something. Straight out of the box, I had to do a factory reset on the plug to get it to work (I have the GE outdoor plug). My ground lights worked fine the first night. However, the next morning I realized the lights/timer had not shut off. I opened up the app, and discovered I needed an update. I have tried and tried to update, to no joy. The directions are no worded very well. And even after trying many different variations there of, nothing. And the app won’t work with out updating. Save your money and find something that’s z-wave.

title: Premium Features are Standard with Everyone Else
text:
I bought an AVI-ON outdoor smart switch a few years ago after the holidays at a discount. In general the idea of a blue tooth controlled timer was great. However AVI-ON requires you to have an online account to access what should be direct connection to a local blue tooth device. 

Now they are trying to up-sell a bridge and requiring a fee for premium features in the app. With this business model I am never going to buy another AVI-ON device. I have many other smart devices that have better features, are more widely compatible and don’t try to charge a subscription fee new features.

To top it all off, the app no longer allows editing of existing schedules as the website says you can do. I tried two different phones with no luck.

I will continue to use the one smart switch that I have, but will eventually replace it with a device in another ecosystem.

title: What happened to scheduling?
text:
I’ve been using this app for years now, but just opened the latest version, and it’s all different. When I go to adjust the scheduler, it just lists 5 random schedules, and when I try to amend one of them, it just asks me to create a new schedule. When I do, it doesn’t save what I just created, and now I can’t effectively use this with schedules. I have 3 total outlets, and now I’m just going to trash them, and add smart bulbs into my existing lighting system. I really liked this, but now it’s effectively useless.
Update: After this horrible canned developer response, I’m done. What a POS.

Like many technologies today, I feel it is on the verge of being so useful but in reality is more annoying than anything. This app works to dim my LED lights and it’s possible to set a schedule to turn them on at specific times with specific dimness. However, there are several features that could be better. 
1. Setting the dimness is not very precise. I often like my lights between 8%-30% bright. The digital slider is very difficult to land on either of these numbers or even settle on one. When sliding from 25% down to 10, lifting the finger off the screen can swing the value 10 or more because the slider size is only maybe a 1/4” inch between 0 and 30. Having a better way to Zoom into low values would help greatly. 
2.  It’s takes an infinity to open and connect to the lights. Like 10 seconds or more. This time, when wanting the lights on or off, seems like forever. The app has to find the light every time it opens, even if you just closed it. There has got to be a remembered connection to hasten the connection. 
3.  I am pretty good with figuring even complex systems and softwares, but this app nearly takes the cake for being non intuitive. Setting the schedule to turn on the lights at 6:30am with a dimness starting at 5% and slowly rising to 20% is possible.  But it might take an hour of messing with the app to make it work. It could be way easier. 
4.  If a schedule is set, you can’t then override the schedule with the light switch on the way. If you do turn off the scheduled lights with the paddle, the lights go crazy and start flickering like mad. I have attempted several ways to get around this but all have failed. 
So, it works but could be so much better.

Also, I can turn the waterfall on and off at any time using the app without affecting the schedule. Definitely worth spending more money to get this device over using a basic cheep 24-hour timer.

title: Good Utility with a Couple Glaring Irritants
text:
I’ve had Avi-On switches for about 2 1/2 years, and on the whole have been fairly happy with them when viewed as early main street technology.  They are simple to set up, simple to use, and reliable.  The advantage of Bluetooth is low power and user complexity, while WiFi offers greater benefits but more overhead and a potential path to hack your home network- so I think GE made the right choice for the time.

The Avi-On app is deceivingly powerful, as you can use it both as a simple remote as well as an easy interface to program schedules with a lot of capability:  from/to dawn/dusk, particular hours can be mixed in, as well as days of the week, yielding possibilities such as “turn the front light on at dawn until 9:00 am on Mondays, Thursdays and Fridays.”  And it’s even more flexible as you can have up to 10 schedules per switch.  So you could add “Turn the front light on at dusk until 11:00 pm.on Wednesdays.”  You would then get the sum of both schedules.

There is also a countdown timer you can use ad-hoc, and a variety of subscription based features to create grouped functionality, like presets for a room of lights.  IMHO the world is full of far too many hi-tech companies delusional that everyone will agree to pay monthly - in this case potentially forever - to have some small service like this.  So we’ll stick with the great bundled capabilities.  

I should mention, though, that you will need to set up a free on-line account to enable any lasting functionality.  The benefit is your device programming and settings are backed up.  And I have found their on-going customer support to be exceptional.  This includes help with the product, as well as rapid turn around in the rare case you identify a software issue.

Really my main complaints are twofold.  One is that EVERY SINGLE TIME an update is pushed, you have to log back in to the controller.  This is terrible, and if they want to survive they must address this.  I have >50 apps on my iPhone; if I had to do this with all of them I’d throw my phone away!

The other, which might be unavoidable, is how long the app takes to refresh EVERY TIME YOU SWITCH TO IT.  Beyond annoying, and another show stopper to real market adoption.

But for now if you have a short list of items you’d find handy to remotely switch, this is any easy way to get it done.  It sure helped while I spent the first half of this year recovering from both cancer and a violent assault, allowing me to switch lights and such while stuck in my recliner.  Or turning Christmas lights outside on and off, while warm inside!

Hope this is helpful to someone.
